[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: add_delta()] [Signed Integer Overflow] When add_delta() is implemented with I128 delta_liquidity, can an attacker pass I128::max() causing (current_liquidity + delta) to overflow u128::max, wrapping to a small liquidity value and allowing theft of position value? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: add_delta()] [Signed Integer Underflow] If delta_liquidity is I128::min() (large negative), will add_delta() allow current_liquidity to underflow below zero, either aborting (DoS) or wrapping to u128::max (catastrophic accounting)? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: add_delta()] [Type Confusion] Can an attacker exploit the I128 to u128 conversion in add_delta() by passing a negative delta that, when cast, produces a large positive u128, inflating liquidity and minting excess shares? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: add_delta()] [Underflow DoS] If current_liquidity is 100 and delta_liquidity is -200, will add_delta() properly abort with a meaningful error, or could it cause a generic abort that prevents legitimate liquidity removal operations? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: add_delta()] [Zero Liquidity Attack] Can an attacker repeatedly call operations that use add_delta() with negative deltas to drain liquidity to exactly zero, then prevent all future operations because liquidity=0 fails downstream checks? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: add_delta()] [I128 Precision Loss] When converting between I128 and u128 in add_delta(), could precision loss in the signed representation cause liquidity to be off by 1, enabling repeated rounding attacks to extract value? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: add_delta()] [Negative Delta Validation] Will add_delta() implementation validate that negative deltas are only applied when sufficient liquidity exists, or could vault operations apply deltas without checking current_liquidity first? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/utils/liquidity_math.move] [Function: add_delta()] [Delta Sign Manipulation] Can an attacker control the sign of delta_liquidity by manipulating upstream calculations (price changes, swap amounts) to force unexpected liquidity increases/decreases?
